textList.text: A civilian Federation ship lost in the nebula contacts you and asks for directions. You share updated star maps with a way how to get to safety without activating any of Lanius ships. In return, the civilians give some resources.
At first you didn't see anything but thick nebula gases, but just before making the next jump, you stumble upon a wreck of a Lanius ship that can be safely harvested for scrap.
The nebula here hides a refueling station. Half of the it is melted by the Lanius, just enough for your crew to get inside and take all of fuel without registering or paying.
This section of nebula is devoid of any activity. Before making the next jump, you were able to extract some low-quality FTL fuel from local gases.
A small part of a Lanius ship destroyed long ago is slowly drifting through the nebula. Closer inspection shows that this section of Lanius ships holds ammunition. You're able to collect some.
You stumble upon the debris of a Lanius ship floating inside nebula. You start collecting the ammunition, but before finishing, you realize that you have lost all the other debris from sight.
The nebula clouds at this beacon shroud a several deactivated hacking drones, commonly used by the Lanius. Your crew is able to utilize them for drone parts.
A package of consumer electronics is drifting through the nebula, ignored by Lanius scavengers. Inside the package, you also find some military-grade drone parts.

event.name: NEBULA_LANIUS_FREE_WEAPON
event.text: A weapon floats at the beacon, aimlessly drifting through nebula. You inspect the weapon and find a decapitated Lanius body still clutching it with immense strength. Thankfully, it didn't put much resistance and you were able to secure the weapon.

event.name: NEBULA_LANIUS_FREE_AUGMENT
event.text: An active Lanius ship is waiting at the beacon. Seeing your ship, it offers an augmentation. There is no way to tell why the Lanius are so generous today.
